publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-961 Michael Russell: Parthenon Marbles-That the Parliament notes the latest request by the Greek Government for the return of the Parthenon Marbles, which were unlawfully taken from Turkish-occupied Athens almost 200 years ago and which are now held by the British Museum in London; rejects claims by the British Museum that they can look after them more effectively than the people of Greece, these being both patronising and also undermined by recent evidence of defective cleaning work carried out by the Museum on the Marbles; believes that, just as the Scots have received back the Stone of Destiny, so the people of Greece have a right to receive back one of their most important artistic and cultural treasures, and calls upon Her Majesty's Government to return the Marbles to their rightful home in Greece.
S1M-961 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 6 June 2000) Shona Robison*
S1M-961 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 6 June 2000) Alasdair Morgan*, Alex Neil*

S1M-961 Michael Russell: Parthenon Marbles-That the Parliament notes the latest request by the Greek Government for the return of the Parthenon Marbles, which were unlawfully taken from Turkish-occupied Athens almost 200 years ago and which are now held by the British Museum in London; rejects claims by the British Museum that they can look after them more effectively than the people of Greece, these being both patronising and also undermined by recent evidence of defective cleaning work carried out by the Museum on the Marbles; believes that, just as the Scots have received back the Stone of Destiny, so the people of Greece have a right to receive back one of their most important artistic and cultural treasures, and calls upon Her Majesty's Government to return the Marbles to their rightful home in Greece. Supported by: Shona Robison, Alasdair Morgan, Alex Neil
S1M-961 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 6 June 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Fergus Ewing*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-961 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 6 June 2000) Mrs Margaret Ewing*
S1M-961 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 6 June 2000) Irene McGugan*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-961 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 6 June 2000) Ms Sandra White*, Bruce Crawford*

S1M-961 Michael Russell: Parthenon Marbles—That the Parliament notes the latest request by the Greek Government for the return of the Parthenon Marbles, which were unlawfully taken from Turkish-occupied Athens almost 200 years ago and which are now held by the British Museum in London; rejects claims by the British Museum that they can look after them more effectively than the people of Greece, these being both patronising and also undermined by recent evidence of defective cleaning work carried out by the Museum on the Marbles; believes that, just as the Scots have received back the Stone of Destiny, so the people of Greece have a right to receive back one of their most important artistic and cultural treasures, and calls upon Her Majesty's Government to return the Marbles to their rightful home in Greece. Supported by: Shona Robison, Alasdair Morgan, Alex Neil, Andrew Wilson, Fergus Ewing, Linda Fabiani, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Irene McGugan, Donald Gorrie, Ms Sandra White, Bruce Crawford
S1M-961 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 6 June 2000) Richard Lochhead*
S1M-961 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 6 June 2000) Mr Adam Ingram*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Mr John Swinney*
S1M-961 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 6 June 2000) Nicola Sturgeon*

S1M-961 Michael Russell: Parthenon Marbles—That the Parliament notes the latest request by the Greek Government for the return of the Parthenon Marbles, which were unlawfully taken from Turkish-occupied Athens almost 200 years ago and which are now held by the British Museum in London; rejects claims by the British Museum that they can look after them more effectively than the people of Greece, these being both patronising and also undermined by recent evidence of defective cleaning work carried out by the Museum on the Marbles; believes that, just as the Scots have received back the Stone of Destiny, so the people of Greece have a right to receive back one of their most important artistic and cultural treasures, and calls upon Her Majesty's Government to return the Marbles to their rightful home in Greece. Supported by: Shona Robison, Alasdair Morgan, Alex Neil, Andrew Wilson, Fergus Ewing, Linda Fabiani, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Irene McGugan, Donald Gorrie, Ms Sandra White, Bruce Crawford, Richard Lochhead, Mr Adam Ingram, Tricia Marwick, Mr Gil Paterson, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr John Swinney, Nicola Sturgeon
S1M-961 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 6 June 2000) Colin Campbell*
S1M-961 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 6 June 2000) Michael Matheson*
